abstract: The decision from Vikram S. Pandit, Citigroup’s chief executive, and Winfried F. W. Bischoff, the bank’s chairman, stands as a test of whether high pay is necessary to retain talented executives.

lead_paragraph: Wall Street is hitting its bankers where it hurts  in the wallet.

headline.main: Citigroup’s Top Executives to Forgo ’08 Bonuses
